Classifies a commit message into a display category (FEATURE, FIX, PERF, CHORE, UPDATE)
Strips the conventional commit prefix (feat:, fix:, chore:, etc.) and version prefix
Dismissible welcome CTA card for the dashboard. Encourages new users to visit the onboarding checklist at /onboarding. Persists dismiss state in localStorage.

localStorage keys for persisting dismissed state and onboarding progress. Client-side-only storage acceptable for non-critical UI preferences. Security warning added: this pattern should NOT be used for security-critical dismissals (use Firestore user preferences instead). Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-040.
Main WelcomeCTA component. Shows a gradient-bordered card with shimmer effect that links to /onboarding. Fades in on mount and animates out on dismiss.
Dismiss handler  persists to localStorage and triggers exit animation.

The onAuthStateChanged listener in FirebaseProvider then syncs providers[] to Firestore.

Upgrade the current user's account by linking an OAuth provider. Accepts a providerId string ('google.com' or 'apple.com') and the Auth instance, then delegates to the correct authService linking function. Throws on failure so the caller can display the error message.

guids.description: Client-side audit logging module providing session correlation IDs, Firestore audit event logging, automatic navigation tracking, and permission error reporting.
Module-level singleton storing the session correlation ID, ensuring all audit events within a single browser session share the same traceable identifier.
Generates a RFC 4122 v4 GUID string using Math.random for use as session correlation IDs.
Returns the current session's correlation ID, lazily generating one on first access to ensure all audit events in a session are linkable.
Module-level flag intended to control whether audit logging is enabled, allowing future integration with a global configuration system.
Writes an audit event to the audit_logs Firestore collection as a fire-and-forget operation, attaching user ID, action description, details, correlation ID, and server timestamp.
React hook that automatically logs page navigation events to the audit trail, distinguishing between initial page load and subsequent route changes.
Logs Firestore permission errors to console only (not to Firestore) to avoid circular permission failures when the user lacks write access to audit_logs.
Central consistency-checking library for the Prix Six application.

Build a Set of all valid driver IDs from the static F1Drivers reference data.

Build a Set of all valid race IDs in normalized form (lowercase, hyphenated)

Validate the static F1Drivers array from data.ts for completeness and uniqueness.

The most comprehensive check function. Validates all score documents against race results and predictions. predictionMap stores PredictionData[] per key to handle Sprint/GP prediction collisions. v07 adds comprehensive double cross-check: breakdown math verification, ghost point detection, per-driver point accuracy (reverse TeamAdmin), forward AdminTeam check, and bonus verification.
Validate that standings (cumulative points per user) are internally consistent.
Validate all league documents for structural integrity and referential
Aggregate all individual CheckResult objects into a single ConsistencyCheckSummary.
Provides standing data for F1 drivers and race schedule used throughout the app.

Define the shape of a Driver object used across the application (public fields only). imageId removed to prevent asset enumeration attacks. Components must use getDriverImage() instead. Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-051.
Internal master list of all F1 drivers for the 2026 season with team assignments and imageId. Now InternalF1Drivers (private). Public export F1Drivers strips imageId. Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-051.

Resolve a driver ID to their profile image URL via the placeholder images lookup. Uses InternalF1Drivers (only sanctioned way to access driver images). Abstracts imageId lookup to prevent enumeration. Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-051.
Resolve a driver ID (lowercase) to their display name (proper case). Uses InternalF1Drivers for consistency. Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-051.
Derive a 3-letter uppercase code from a driver ID (e.g., "hamilton" -> "HAM"). Uses InternalF1Drivers for consistency. Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-051.
Convert an array of driver IDs into a comma-separated string of display names.
Define the shape of a Race object including timing, location, sprint flag, and results.
Master race calendar for the 2026 F1 season (24 races). Defines qualifying deadlines
Find the next upcoming race based on the current date by comparing qualifying times.
Server-side email sending module using Microsoft Graph API via Azure AD credentials. Provides welcome emails and generic email dispatch with rate-limiting, queuing, and Firestore logging.
Initialise and return a Firebase Admin Firestore instance for server-side email logging. Uses service account credentials if available, otherwise falls back to default project initialisation.

Admin email address constant used as the default sender fallback. Uses ADMIN_EMAIL environment variable if set, otherwise falls back to hardcoded value. Single source of truth for admin email (Golden Rule #3). Security fix: GEMINI-AUDIT-055.
Generate a RFC 4122 v4-style GUID for uniquely identifying each email sent, enabling tracking and audit trail lookup.

Create and return an authenticated Microsoft Graph API client using Azure AD client credentials (tenant ID, client ID, client secret). This client is used to send emails via the Graph /sendMail endpoint.
Type definition for the result returned by email-sending functions, indicating success/failure, the tracking GUID, optional error detail, and whether the email was queued due to rate limiting.
Type definition for the parameters required to send a welcome email, including recipient, team name, PIN, and optional Firestore instance for rate-limit tracking.

Send a branded welcome email to a newly registered user containing their team name and 6-digit PIN. Enforces rate limiting via email-tracking, queues if rate-limited, logs success/failure to email_logs collection, and returns a tracking GUID.
Type definition for generic email parameters (recipient, subject, HTML content) used by the general-purpose sendEmail function.

Send a generic email with arbitrary HTML content via Microsoft Graph API. Appends a standard footer with tracking GUID and Prix Six branding. Logs success/failure to email_logs collection for admin audit.

Client-side email tracking and rate-limiting module. Manages daily email statistics, enforces global and per-address send limits, provides email queuing for rate-limited messages, and generates daily summary HTML reports.
Rate-limit constants defining the maximum number of emails allowed per day globally and per individual recipient address.

Type definition for daily email statistics stored in the email_daily_stats Firestore collection, tracking total sent count, individual email log entries, and whether the daily summary has been dispatched.
Type definition for an individual email log entry within the daily stats, capturing recipient, subject, type, team, tracking GUID, timestamp, and delivery status.
Type definition for a queued email document stored in the email_queue Firestore collection when rate limits prevent immediate sending.
Return today's date as a YYYY-MM-DD string for use as the Firestore document ID in email_daily_stats.
Retrieve or create the daily email statistics document for today from the email_daily_stats Firestore collection. If no document exists for today, initialises one with zero counts.
Count how many emails have been sent to a specific email address today, using case-insensitive matching against the daily stats log.
Check whether the system is allowed to send an email to the given address by validating against the daily global limit and per-address limit. The admin email is exempt from per-address limits.
Record a successfully sent email in today's daily stats document by incrementing the total count and appending the log entry to the emailsSent array.
Queue an email for later sending when rate limits prevent immediate dispatch. Creates a document in the email_queue Firestore collection with pending status.
Retrieve the list of all email log entries recorded in today's daily stats, for use in generating the daily summary report.
Mark the daily summary email as sent in today's stats document to prevent duplicate summary emails within the same day.
Check whether the daily summary email has already been sent today, to prevent duplicate summaries.
Retrieve all pending queued emails from the email_queue Firestore collection for batch processing.
Update the status of a queued email document after processing (sent or failed), recording the processing timestamp and optional error message.
Generate a styled HTML email body for the daily email summary report, showing counts of sent, queued, and failed emails in a table format with statistics boxes.
Central error code registry and error handling utilities for the Prix Six application.
Master registry of all application error codes organised by category.

Client-side file upload utility module for profile photo management. Provides image validation, upload with progress tracking to Firebase Storage, deletion of old photos, and client-side image compression using canvas.
Constants defining the allowed image MIME types and maximum file size (5MB) for profile photo uploads.
Type definition for the result of file validation, indicating whether the file passes constraints and an optional error message if not.
Type definition for upload progress state, providing a percentage (0-100) and a state indicator used to update the UI progress bar.
Validate a File object against allowed MIME types and maximum file size before attempting upload. Returns a ValidationResult indicating pass/fail with a user-friendly error message.

Upload a profile photo to Firebase Storage under profile-photos/{userId}/{timestamp}.{ext}, with real-time progress reporting via an optional callback. Validates the file first, then uses resumable upload for reliability.

Delete a profile photo from Firebase Storage by extracting the storage path from the download URL and calling deleteObject. Silently fails if the photo does not exist or the URL is external, as this is a best-effort cleanup.

Compress an image file client-side by resizing it to a maximum width (default 400px) while maintaining aspect ratio, and re-encoding as JPEG at a configurable quality level (default 0.8). Uses HTML5 Canvas for image manipulation.
Server-side Firebase Admin SDK initialisation and shared utilities for authentication verification, correlation ID generation, and centralised error logging.
Module-level singleton cache for the Firebase Admin SDK app, Firestore instance, FieldValue, and Timestamp to avoid re-initialisation on every request.

Lazily initialises the Firebase Admin SDK (choosing between explicit service account credentials for local dev or Application Default Credentials for Google Cloud) and returns the Firestore instance, FieldValue, and Timestamp utilities.
Verifies a Firebase ID token from an Authorization header and returns the decoded user identity (uid and email), or null if invalid/missing.
Generates a unique correlation ID for error tracking, combining a base-36 timestamp with a random suffix to ensure uniqueness.
Persists error details (message, stack trace, context, correlation ID) to the error_logs Firestore collection for centralised error tracking and debugging.

Client-side league management module providing CRUD operations for custom leagues. Handles league creation, joining via invite codes, leaving, member removal, renaming, invite code regeneration, and deletion. All operations interact with the leagues Firestore collection.
Generate a cryptographically random invite code of INVITE_CODE_LENGTH characters using an alphabet that excludes visually ambiguous characters (I, O, 0, 1) to reduce user input errors.
Create a new custom league in Firestore with the requesting user as owner and sole initial member. Enforces the maximum leagues-per-user limit before creation.

Client-side OAuth authentication service for Google and Apple sign-in. Provides popup-with-redirect-fallback sign-in, provider linking/unlinking, Apple nonce generation, and mobile detection. All OAuth must happen client-side because Firebase OAuth requires browser interaction. sign-in, linking, and unlinking operations. the user profile. New OAuth users (no Firestore doc) are routed to complete-profile by the provider's auth state handler.

Type definitions for OAuth operation results, providing structured success/error responses with optional pending credential for account-linking flows. conditional rendering of success, error, and linking prompts.

Detect mobile devices via userAgent and viewport width to determine whether to use signInWithPopup (desktop) or signInWithRedirect (mobile). Mobile Safari blocks popups, so redirect is mandatory on mobile. would cause popup-blocked errors on mobile.

Detect Gmail plus-addressing (e.g. user+tag@gmail.com) which shares the same Google account as the base address (user@gmail.com). When linking Google OAuth, Firebase sees the base address, causing auth/credential-already-in-use if another Firebase Auth user already has that Google credential linked.
Extract the list of provider IDs from a Firebase Auth user's providerData array. components that display linked provider status.

Sign in with Google using popup (desktop) or redirect (mobile). Handles popup-blocked errors by falling back to redirect. Detects account-exists-with-different-credential for linking flows. returns pendingCredential for the UI to prompt PIN sign-in first.

Sign in with Apple using popup on all platforms. Apple Sign-In on iOS uses the native system authentication sheet (not a browser popup), so signInWithPopup works reliably on mobile. The previous signInWithRedirect approach was broken by Safari ITP clearing the auth session during redirect.
Link a Google account to the currently signed-in user. Uses popup on desktop with redirect fallback. handler will sync the new providers list to Firestore.
Link an Apple account to the currently signed-in user.
Unlink a sign-in provider from the current user. Caller must verify this isn't the last provider before calling.
Central error handler for OAuth sign-in errors. Maps Firebase error codes to application error codes and handles popup-blocked fallback to redirect.
Central error handler for provider linking errors. Detects Gmail plus-addressing to provide specific guidance when auth/credential-already-in-use occurs.

Scheduled Cloud Function (every 15 min) that expires stale Active sessions in user_logons after 24 hours. Queries sessionStatus=='Active' with logonTimestamp older than cutoff, batch-updates to 'Session Expired'.

PX-6006.recovery: Function retries on next 15-minute schedule. Stale sessions remain Active until next successful run.

guids.description: TypeScript interfaces for the traced-error system. Defines the shape of error definitions (from code.json), traced error instances (runtime), and severity levels. Every error in the system answers four diagnostic questions: Where? What? Known failures? Who triggered it?
Defines the full shape of an error definition sourced from code.json's errorProfile.emits entries. Each field answers one of the four diagnostic questions required by Golden Rule #7.

Extends the standard Error with traced-error metadata. Created at runtime by createTracedError() and passed to logTracedError() for persistence. The correlationId links user reports to server logs. must remain parseable by support workflows.

WhatsApp Worker main entry point - Express server that manages WhatsApp Web.js client lifecycle, provides health/status/QR endpoints, and coordinates queue processing for outbound messages. Critical infrastructure for WhatsApp integration.

WhatsApp Web.js client wrapper with Azure Blob Storage session persistence, keep-alive pings, QR code generation, and platform-specific Puppeteer configuration. Handles authentication, disconnection recovery, and group message sending.
Firebase Storage adapter for WhatsApp RemoteAuth session persistence. Saves/loads session.json from Firebase Storage bucket for container-safe session recovery. Legacy fallback to Azure Blob Store.
Azure Blob Storage adapter for WhatsApp RemoteAuth session persistence. Uploads/downloads session.zip to Azure container for production deployments. Used when AZURE_STORAGE_CONNECTION_STRING is set.

Firestore queue listener that processes whatsapp_queue collection documents. Monitors PENDING messages, applies rate limiting (5-10s between messages), retries failures up to 3 times, and updates status to SENT/FAILED.

Firebase Admin SDK initialization for WhatsApp worker. Supports service account JSON from env var (containerized), GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS, or local service-account.json. Exports getFirestore and getStorage helpers.
Type declaration module for qrcode-terminal package (missing TypeScript definitions). Declares generate() and setErrorLevel() functions.

DnD-Kit context wrapper for drag-and-drop prediction grid. Manages drag state, parses pool/slot IDs, handles pool-to-slot drops, slot-to-slot swaps, and slot-to-pool removals. Uses PointerSensor (8px threshold) and TouchSensor (200ms delay).
Thin wrapper around @dnd-kit/core useDraggable hook. Applies transform CSS, 0.4 opacity when dragging, and touch-action:none. Used for both pool drivers and grid slot drivers.
Drag overlay preview component displayed during drag operations. Shows driver avatar and name in a floating card with shadow-xl. Styled with pointer-events-none to prevent interaction.

Droppable slot for prediction grid (P1-P6). Shows driver avatar when filled, position label (P1-P6), remove button, and up/down move arrows. Right lane slots have translate-y-6 offset. Highlights green (empty) or amber (swap) on drag-over.

Droppable pool zone containing available drivers in a 2-column scrollable grid. Each driver is wrapped in DraggableDriver and also clickable for instant selection. Highlights green with shadow glow on drag-over.

Next.js middleware for CSRF protection on state-changing requests (POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE). Validates Origin header matches Host or X-Forwarded-Host. Returns 403 on mismatch. Applies security headers (X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, Vary).

Root Next.js layout wrapping entire application. Initializes FirebaseClientProvider, FirebaseServicesTracker (Analytics + Performance), Toaster, and global dark mode. Performance instrumentation disabled to avoid Tailwind class name overflow errors.

Authenticated app layout (wraps all /app routes). Enforces authentication, checks single-user mode, manages session heartbeat (5min intervals, 15min timeout), renders AppSidebar, displays verification/conversion/preseason banners. Wraps children in SessionProvider and LeagueProvider.

Root-level error boundary for client-side errors in root layout. Generates client correlation ID, logs error to /api/log-client-error, displays AlertTriangle card with [PX-9999] code and correlation ID. Includes Reset and Home buttons.

Global error boundary that catches errors in root layout (replaces entire HTML document). Uses inline styles for dark theme. Logs [PX-2001] NETWORK_ERROR to /api/log-client-error with correlation ID. Renders complete html/body structure.

App-level error boundary for authenticated routes (/app/*). Logs [PX-9999] UNKNOWN_ERROR with correlation ID. Displays AlertTriangle card with error digest (useful for stale Server Action cache). Includes Reset and Home buttons.

Auth route error boundary for login/signup pages. Logs [PX-9999] UNKNOWN_ERROR with correlation ID. Displays full-height centered AlertTriangle card. Includes Reset button (no Home button since user not authenticated).
Firebase client config object sourced from NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_* environment variables. Exported as firebaseConfig constant. Used by client-side Firebase initialization.

Firebase client SDK initialization. initializeFirebase() attempts automatic Firebase App Hosting env vars first, falls back to firebaseConfig. getSdks() returns firebaseApp, auth, firestore, storage, functions (europe-west2). Re-exports all Firebase modules.
Firebase client SDK initialization for server-side usage (Server Components, API routes). Initializes app once on import, exports app and firestore singletons. Used by server-only code paths.
Client-side Firebase provider wrapper. Calls initializeFirebase() once on mount (useMemo with empty deps) and passes services to FirebaseProvider. Wraps entire app at root layout level.

CRITICAL: Central Firebase context provider managing auth state, user profile, login/signup/logout/PIN operations. Single source of truth for current user session. Exposes useAuth(), useFirebase(), useFirestore(), useStorage(), useFunctions() hooks. Referenced by FIREBASE_PROVIDER-000 through FIREBASE_PROVIDER-028 GUIDs.

React hook for Firestore collection/query real-time subscriptions. Returns {data, isLoading, error}. Requires memoized query input. Handles permission errors with 3-second delay before emitting to errorEmitter (allows transient auth sync). Adds id field to each doc.

React hook for Firestore document real-time subscriptions. Returns {data, isLoading, error}. Requires memoized docRef input. Handles permission errors with 3-second delay before emitting to errorEmitter. Returns null if doc doesn't exist.

Firestore utility functions for app-settings documents. Handles hot news settings (content, isLocked, hotNewsFeedEnabled) and WhatsApp alert settings (master toggle, test mode, alert toggles, history). Includes default values and merge logic.
React context for current user session ID. SessionProvider wraps app layout and passes sessionId from app layout's session heartbeat logic. useSession() hook exposes sessionId to child components.

React context for user's leagues and selected league. LeagueProvider subscribes to leagues collection (where memberUserIds array-contains user.id), sorts global first then alphabetically, persists selectedLeague to localStorage. useLeague() hook not exported but available.

Genkit AI SDK initialization for Vertex AI (Google Cloud). Configured for project studio-6033436327-281b1, location europe-west4, model vertexai/gemini-2.0-flash. Exported as ai singleton. Used by AI analysis features.

AUTO-GENERATED error registry mapping error keys to ErrorDefinition objects. Sourced from code.json GUIDs' errorProfile.emits. Each ERRORS entry includes code (PX-XXXX), GUID, module, file, message, severity, recovery steps, and failure modes. Used by all catch blocks.
Client-side chunk load error detector that auto-refreshes the page when Next.js fails to load a webpack chunk (typically due to stale build after deployment).
Detects if an error is a webpack chunk loading failure by checking error message and error type.
Main component that sets up global error listener on mount, detects chunk errors, shows user-friendly toast, and auto-refreshes after 1.5s delay.
EMAIL-006 Phase 1B migration script - retroactively masks plaintext PINs in email_logs collection
EMAIL-006 Phase 1B rollback script - restores original plaintext PINs from backup if migration fails
Admin component for centralized book of work tracking with 4-pillar error handling and loading progress using useRef to prevent infinite loop

Scheduled Cloud Function (Python) that runs hourly to generate and update Paddock Pub newsletter content. Fetches F1 news from RSS feeds, weather data from Open-Meteo, and uses Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite AI with two-phase generation (draft + editorial QA) to create satirical newsletter voiced by four personas. Sanitizes AI-generated HTML and writes to app-settings/pub-chat Firestore document.

metadata.trigger: Cloud Scheduler - cron: '0 * * * *' (every hour on the hour)
metadata.security: GEMINI-003 fix - bleach HTML sanitization prevents XSS from malicious RSS feeds

guids.description: Python dependencies for the Paddock Pub Chat hourly updater Cloud Function. Includes functions-framework, bleach (HTML sanitization), feedparser (RSS), firebase-admin, google-genai (Gemini AI), and requests.
gcloudignore file for Paddock Pub Chat Cloud Function deployment. Excludes development files, caches, and local environments from being uploaded to Google Cloud.
Cloud Scheduler job that triggers the Paddock Pub Chat updater every hour (cron: '0 * * * *'). Ensures newsletter content stays fresh 24x7 with latest F1 news and weather updates.
